clinical_study.brief_title: Prevalence, Strain Circulation and Disease Burden Study of Seasonal Influenza A and B in Panama, Selected Countries of Central America and the Caribbean From the Year 2010 to 2015
clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence, Strain Circulation and Disease Burden of Seasonal Influenza A and B in Panama, Selected Countries of Central America and the Caribbean From the Year 2010 to 2015

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the prevalence, strain circulation and disease burden of seasonal Influenza A and B in Panama, selected countries of Central America and the Caribbean from the Year 2010 to 2015.

detailed_description.textblock:
The Gorgas Memorial Institute for Health Studies (ICGES) is a public health institution established in Panama dedicated to health research and disease prevention. It has been performing virological isolations of influenza and is a part of the World Health Organisation (WHO) Global Influenza Surveillance and Response System (GISRS) and a direct collaborator of the CDC.
From 2010 a sentinel surveillance program is being conducted in Panama within the ICGES to collect data on influenza and other respiratory viruses using CDC guidance for Respiratory Disease Surveillance. This study aims to utilize this data source for analyzing the burden of influenza within the region.

primary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of seasonal influenza A and/or B cases by age, virus subtype and strain lineage, in Panama, selected countries of Central America and the Caribbean (using the data reported via National Influenza Surveillance Program).
primary_outcome.description: Assessment by age ranges- <1, 1-4, 5-9, 10-14, 15-19, 20-24, 25-44, 45-49, 50-59, 60-64 and ≥65 years, virus subtype- A-virus subtype (AH1N1/A H3N2) and B-strain lineage (Victoria and Yamagata).

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of clinical features and outcomes (clinical symptoms, duration of illness, complications) experienced by subjects who have laboratory confirmed diagnosis seasonal influenza A and/or B.
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical features and outcomes experienced by influenza positive subjects by type of influenza (seasonal influenza A and/or B) in different seasons from 2010-2015.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of frequency of seasonal influenza A and/or B cases reported in different temporal and geographical locations.
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment by geographical distribution by country and by region within the country (if data available).

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of influenza caused by B-strain and presented by B lineages among the study population by age and by region.
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment by age ranges- <1, 1-4, 5-9, 10-14, 15-19, 20-24, 25-44, 45-49, 50-59, 60-64 and ≥65 and by selected study regions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of characteristics of the influenza B-infection as observed in the database and the B-strain included in the trivalent influenza vaccine.
secondary_outcome.description: Estimation of the proportion of matched B-strains and mis-matched B-strains.

arm_group.description: All subjects who have laboratory confirmed diagnosis of influenza (laboratory confirmed case) and reported in the national influenza surveillance system from the Year 2010-2015.

intervention.description: The ICGES database of Panama will be checked for all seasonal influenza A and/or B positive cases reported via influenza surveillance programs from 2010 to 2015.

study_pop.textblock: The Total population will include all subjects included in the study. Information will only be collected for all eligible subjects (aggregated) captured by the ICGES Database.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All subjects diagnosed with seasonal influenza A and/or B, reported in the ICGES database of Panama, from January 2010 to December 2015.
